item.title: Massive flytipping, 6th February
item.description:

item.title: Dead adult fox near Woolwich Road flyover, 6th February
item.description:
There has been a dead fox near the A102 pedestrian crossing behind Alan's Plants for the last couple of days. It is lying among a load of dumped rubbish on a verge.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tunnel Avenue, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paving slabs dangerously uneven, 6th February
item.description:
In two places one adjacent to 75 larchwood and one in front of it the paving slabs are now so broken and uneven that it's a trip hazard the difference in height in some places is almost the depth of a paving slabs. Should be urgently addressed before someone is injured. Noticed today when visiting a relative not sure how long it's been there.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwood Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing sign due to poor workmanship 8305699, 6th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Elmfield Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 6th February
item.description:
81 Woodhurst Road obtained planning permission to build a three bedroom house The rear of the property backs onto Manton Road yesterday at 1:25 people working on the property moved out their van for another van to come in. They emptied their van in front of 69 Manton Road after emptying their van they then back the van into the back entrance of 81 which is now numbered 81 A Woodhurst road - which shows clearly the are all linked and working together. All this was picked up by my Ring doorbell.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Manton Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive Pothole just at the back of a speed bump on Baring Road near the intersection with Coopers Lane street., 6th February
item.description:
This pothole has been there for weeks and its getting worst. No one has come to fix it and it's extremely dangerous especially it being somewhat "invisible " because its at the back side of a speed bump. I drive on this road every morning and night for the school run as do many other parents so its a major issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 268, Baring Road, Chinbrook, Grove Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
